data.title: The Conan Doyle
data.meta_description: Traditional bar in Broughton area with a range of real ales and pub food.
data.text:
A short stroll from Picardy Place, Cathedral Lane and Queens Street, The Conan Doyle is a traditional pub with an eclectic range of real ales and pub food.

The pub is part of the Nicholsons chain of pubs.

Sherlock Holmes author Sir Arthur Conan Doyle was born at Picardy Place near here on 22nd May 1859.

Today, an over life-sized bronze statue of Doyle's famous detective stands opposite his birthplace, portrayed in meditation over the death of his author.
